race.name: Turnhout Gravel
race.tagline: Belgian Kempen—100km of forest gravel, 1,200m elevation, September rain, Belgian beer.

terrain.surface: 80% gravel, 20% paved roads. Belgian Kempen—rolling terrain, forest paths. 1,200 m over 100 km. Turnhout area. Technical rating: 3/5.

biased_opinion.summary: Turnhout Gravel is Belgian Kempen—100 km, 1,200 m elevation. Founded ~2021. 80% gravel, 20% paved. Belgian Kempen—rolling terrain, forest paths. 400-600 riders. Turnhout, Belgium. September autumn conditions (12-20°C, 40% rain). Affordable entry (€70-€100 / $75-$110). If you want Belgian forest gravel with affordable entry and Belgian beer, this is it. If you need dry weather, skip it. September rain 40%.
biased_opinion.bottom_line: Turnhout Gravel is Belgian Kempen forest gravel. 100 km, 1,200 m, September rain 40%. If you want Belgian forest gravel with affordable entry, this is it. If you need dry weather, skip it. Rain is the challenge. Post-race Belgian beer.

black_pill.title: SEPTEMBER RAIN (40%) + BELGIAN MUD
black_pill.reality: September Belgium = 40% rain. Cold (12-20°C). Belgian gravel = mud when wet. 10-15% DNF. You'll pay €70-€100 ($75-$110) + international travel. If you need dry weather, this isn't it. If you want Belgian forest gravel with affordable entry, this is it. Rain is the challenge. Bring waterproofs.
black_pill.expectation_reset: Turnhout Gravel is Belgian forest gravel. September rain 40%, cold, mud when wet. If you need dry weather, skip it. If you want Belgian Kempen with affordable entry, this is it. Rain is the challenge. Post-race Belgian beer.

logistics.travel_summary: Fly to Brussels (BRU). Rental car or train (60 km, 1-hour drive to Turnhout). Town lodging—book early. Day-before packet pickup. Race September. Post-race Belgian beer.
logistics.food_options: Aid stations on course. Post-race party with Belgian beer.

course_description.character: 100 km, 1,200 m. 80% gravel, 20% paved. Belgian Kempen—rolling terrain, forest paths. Technical rating: 3/5.

suffering_zones.name: Throughout: Belgian Kempen Rolling Terrain
suffering_zones.description: Rolling Belgian forest paths. 1,200 m cumulative elevation. Manageable.
suffering_zones.survival_strategy: Moderate gears. Steady pace. Cumulative elevation manageable. 100 km long.

suffering_zones.name: Throughout: September Rain
suffering_zones.description: September = 40% rain. Cold (12-20°C). Belgian gravel = mud when wet.
suffering_zones.survival_strategy: Waterproofs. Layers. Manage cold/wet. Mud when wet. Bring spares.

course_description.signature_challenge: 100 km + September rain (40%) + Belgian mud when wet.

history.origin_story: Turnhout Gravel founded ~2021. Turnhout, Belgium. 100 km, 400-600 riders. Belgian Kempen forest gravel.
history.reputation: Belgian gravel scene. Turnhout. Well-organized. Affordable entry. Forest paths.
